raw_text: CONSULTANT       Summary    College graduate with interest in insurance claims work. Proven record of success in all endeavors. Strong work ethic and focus on the details. story:
Let me transform this resume into a story:

Meet a dedicated technology professional whose journey in the data and analytics world spans over two decades. Their story begins with a solid educational foundation, earning degrees in Information Management Systems from Wayne State University and Accounting from Wayne County Community College, where they graduated with distinction.

Starting in 1999, they cut their teeth as a Business Analyst, working with major financial institutions including Fifth Third Bank. During this 12-year tenure, they became an expert in handling complex financial datasets and serving as a bridge between technical teams and clients.

Their career evolved as they took on more specialized roles, including a position as a Business Analyst focusing on HR/payroll systems from 2012 to 2013. Here, they mastered SAP Business Objects and various database technologies, while developing a keen eye for optimizing system performance.

Moving forward, they transitioned into reporting analytics, where from 2013 to 2015, they became proficient in translating complex business requirements into practical solutions using tools like SQL Server and Crystal Reports. Their expertise in data warehouse implementation and ETL processes began to shine during this period.

The next chapter of their career saw them elevate to a Senior Business Intelligence Analyst position, where they excelled in developing WebI reports and providing technical support for database performance issues. Their role expanded to include collaborating with business SMEs and conducting user acceptance testing.

As a Database Analyst in 2016, they tackled complex computer application problems and helped maintain system functionality, all while ensuring high data quality standards were met.

Currently, they serve as a Consultant for a top 4 financial institution, where they create SQL queries, analyze data for executive dashboards, and work to enhance data integrity. Their extensive technical toolkit includes everything from SQL Server and Oracle to modern visualization tools like Tableau, making them a versatile professional in the data analytics space.

Throughout their career, they've maintained a strong focus on continuous learning, adapting to new technologies, and bridging the gap between technical capabilities and business needs. Their story is one of constant growth and evolution in the ever-changing landscape of data technology.
